abstract: Thaw in relationship between United States and Cuba brings Radio and TV Marti to crossroads after three decades of broadcasting anti-Castro programming from US; two broadcasts are still illegal and mostly blocked in Cuba and Pres Raul Castro has made their shutdown a condition of normalizing relations with US.
lead_paragraph: The Martís are illegal on the island, and President Raúl Castro has made their shutdown a condition of normalizing relations with the United States.

headline.main: Radio and TV Martí, U.S. Broadcasters to Cuba, Emerge From Cold War Past Facing Uneasy Future
headline.print_headline: Out of Cold War Past, Broadcasts to Cuba Face an Uneasy Future

snippet: The Martís are illegal on the island, and President Raúl Castro has made their shutdown a condition of normalizing relations with the United States.
